0.Pros: customers and co-workers were mostly friendly. If you do it long enough you'll become quick at the cash register or the grill and you'll really feel like youve mastered something
0.Cons: management was hit or miss. I had some that were very helpful and wanted to educate me about learning skills to apply in the workplace... while some were kind of rude and innapropriate

1.Cons: Pay. They hire kids as young as 14. Young kids are good workers, but are kids just the same and lose focus and wine. Should not schedule 14 year olds for 8 hours.

2.Pros: If you like the people you work with, it can be fun. Fast paced.
2.Cons: Rude customers from time to time. Frustrating at times when the kitchen slows down a bit. Depending on the manager, it can be complete hell.

3.Pros: You get free food and ice cream
3.Cons: No respect for schedule, no proper training, lack of respect

5.Pros: You get to eat all the food
5.Cons: Fast paced, rude customers, horrible pay

7.Summary: "It was a great job they worked with your hrs"
7.Pros: Its a great place to be they have the best food in the world
7.Cons: Its a very fast paced enviorment and things could easily get you upset quick

8.Pros: Free milkshakes and drinks, discount on food, and sometimes nice customers
8.Cons: Bad work hours, to many customers, manager doesn't fix problems, food is unsafe, bad pay

9.Pros: You can get hired easily and is a fairly repetitive task
9.Cons: It is a very repetitive task, unkind managers
